019package org.jgrapes.io.process;
020
021import java.io.FileDescriptor;
022import java.io.IOException;
023import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
024import java.util.HashSet;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.Set;
027import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
028import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
029import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
030import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
031import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
032import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
033import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
034import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
035import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel;
036import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel.DefaultIOSubchannel;
037import org.jgrapes.io.events.Close;
038import org.jgrapes.io.events.Closed;
039import org.jgrapes.io.events.Input;
040import org.jgrapes.io.events.Opening;
041import org.jgrapes.io.events.Output;
042import org.jgrapes.io.events.ProcessExited;
043import org.jgrapes.io.events.ProcessStarted;
044import org.jgrapes.io.events.StartProcess;
045import org.jgrapes.io.events.StartProcessError;
046import org.jgrapes.io.util.InputStreamPipeline;
047
048/**
049 * Provides a component that executes processes. A process is started
050 * by firing a {@link StartProcess} event. In response, the
051 * {@link ProcessManager} starts the process and creates a 
052 * {@link ProcessChannel} (i.e. an {@link IOSubchannel) for communication
053 * with the process. It fires an {@link Opening} and {@link ProcessStarted} 
054 * event on the newly created channel.
055 * 
056 * Data may be sent to the process's stdin by firing {@link Output}
057 * events on the {@link ProcessChannel}. As usual, these events should
058 * be fired using the channels {@link IOSubchannel#responsePipeline()
059 * response pipeline}. Data generated by the process is provided by
060 * {@link Input} events. In order to distinguish between stdout and stderr,
061 * the events have an association with class {@link FileDescriptor} as
062 * key and an associated value of 1 (stdout) or 2 (stderr).
063 * 
064 * When the process terminated, three {@link Closed} events are fired on
065 * the {@link ProcessChannel} one each for stdout and stderr (with the
066 * same association as was used for the {@link Input} events) and a 
067 * as third event a {@link ProcessExited} (specialized {@link Closed})
068 * with the process's exit value. Note that the sequence in which these
069 * events are sent is undefined.
070 */
071@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
072public class ProcessManager extends Component {
073
074    private ExecutorService executorService
075        = Components.defaultExecutorService();
076    private final Set<ProcessChannel> channels = new HashSet<>();
077
078    /**
079     * Creates a new connector, using itself as component channel. 
080     */
081    public ProcessManager() {
082        this(Channel.SELF);
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Create a new instance using the given channel.
087     *
088     * @param componentChannel the component channel
089     */
090    public ProcessManager(Channel componentChannel) {
091        super(componentChannel);
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Sets an executor service to be used by the event pipelines
096     * that forward data from the process.
097     * 
098     * @param executorService the executorService to set
099     * @return the process manager for easy chaining
100     * @see Manager#newEventPipeline(ExecutorService)
101     */
102    public ProcessManager setExecutorService(ExecutorService executorService) {
103        this.executorService = executorService;
104        return this;
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Start a new process using the data from the event.
109     *
110     * @param event the event
111     */
112    @Handler
113    public void onStartProcess(StartProcess event) {
114        var pbd = new ProcessBuilder(event.command());
115        if (event.directory() != null) {
116            pbd.directory(event.directory());
117        }
118        if (event.environment() != null) {
119            Map<String, String> env = pbd.environment();
120            for (var entry : event.environment().entrySet()) {
121                if (entry.getValue() == null) {
122                    env.remove(entry.getValue());
123                    continue;
124                }
125                env.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
126            }
127        }
128        try {
129            new ProcessChannel(event, pbd.start());
130        } catch (IOException e) {
131            fire(new StartProcessError(event, "Failed to start process.", e));
132        }
133    }
134
135    /**
136     * Writes the data passed in the event. 
137     * 
138     * The end of record flag is used to determine if a channel is 
139     * eligible for purging. If the flag is set and all output has 
140     * been processed, the channel is purgeable until input is 
141     * received or another output event causes the state to be 
142     * reevaluated. 
143     *
144     * @param event the event
145     * @param channel the channel
146     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
147     * @throws IOException 
148     */
149    @Handler
150    public void onOutput(Output<ByteBuffer> event,
151            ProcessChannel channel) throws InterruptedException, IOException {
152        if (channels.contains(channel)) {
153            channel.write(event);
154        }
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Closes the output to the process.
159     *
160     * @param event the event
161     * @throws IOException if an I/O exception occurred
162     * @throws InterruptedException if the execution was interrupted
163     */
164    @Handler
165    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
166    public void onClose(Close event) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
167        for (Channel channel : event.channels()) {
168            if (channel instanceof ProcessChannel
169                && channels.contains(channel)) {
170                ((ProcessChannel) channel).close(event);
171            }
172        }
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * Handles closed events from stdout and stderr.
177     *
178     * @param event the event
179     * @throws IOException if an I/O exception occurred
180     * @throws InterruptedException if the execution was interrupted
181     */
182    @Handler(priority = -100)
183    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
184    public void onClosed(Closed<?> event)
185            throws IOException, InterruptedException {
186        for (Channel channel : event.channels()) {
187            if (channel instanceof ProcessChannel
188                && channels.contains(channel)) {
189                ((ProcessChannel) channel).closed(event);
190            }
191        }
192    }
193
194    /**
195     * The Class ProcessChannel.
196     */
197    public class ProcessChannel extends DefaultIOSubchannel {
198
199        private final StartProcess startEvent;
200        private final Process process;
201        private final EventPipeline downPipeline;
202        private boolean running;
203        private boolean outOpen;
204        private boolean errOpen;
205
206        /**
207         * Instantiates a new process channel.
208         *
209         * @param startEvent the start event
210         * @param process the process
211         */
212        private ProcessChannel(StartProcess startEvent, Process process) {
213            super(channel(), newEventPipeline());
214            this.startEvent = startEvent;
215            this.process = process;
216            synchronized (ProcessManager.this) {
217                if (channels.isEmpty()) {
218                    registerAsGenerator();
219                }
220                channels.add(this);
221            }
222            running = true;
223            process.onExit().thenAccept(p -> {
224                running = false;
225                downPipeline()
226                    .fire(new ProcessExited(startEvent, p.exitValue()), this);
227                maybeUnregister();
228            });
229
230            if (executorService == null) {
231                downPipeline = newEventPipeline();
232            } else {
233                downPipeline = newEventPipeline(executorService);
234            }
235
236            // (1) Opening, (2) ProcessStarted(Opened), (3) process I/O
237            downPipeline().fire(Event.onCompletion(new Opening<Void>(),
238                o -> downPipeline().fire(Event.onCompletion(
239                    new ProcessStarted(startEvent), s -> startIO()), this)),
240                this);
241        }
242
243        /**
244         * Write the given data to the process (to its stdin).
245         *
246         * @param event the event
247         * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
248         */
249        private void write(Output<ByteBuffer> event) throws IOException {
250            var source = event.buffer().backingBuffer();
251            process.getOutputStream().write(source.array(), source.position(),
252                source.remaining());
253        }
254
255        private void startIO() {
256            // Regrettably, the streams cannot be used with nio select.
257            outOpen = true;
258            executorService.submit(
259                new InputStreamPipeline(process.getInputStream(), this,
260                    downPipeline()).sendInputEvents()
261                        .setEventAssociations(Map.of(FileDescriptor.class, 1)));
262            errOpen = true;
263            executorService.submit(
264                new InputStreamPipeline(process.getErrorStream(), this,
265                    downPipeline()).sendInputEvents()
266                        .setEventAssociations(Map.of(FileDescriptor.class, 2)));
267        }
268
269        /**
270         * Close the stream to the process (its stdin).
271         *
272         * @param event the event
273         * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
274         */
275        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UnusedFormalParameter")
276        private void close(Close event) throws IOException {
277            process.getOutputStream().close();
278        }
279
280        /**
281         * Handles closed events from the process's output stream. 
282         *
283         * @param event the event
284         */
285        private void closed(Closed<?> event) {
286            switch (event.associated(FileDescriptor.class, Integer.class)
287                .orElse(-1)) {
288            case 1:
289                outOpen = false;
290                break;
291            case 2:
292                errOpen = false;
293                break;
294            default:
295                return;
296            }
297            maybeUnregister();
298        }
299
300        private void maybeUnregister() {
301            if (!running && !outOpen && !errOpen) {
302                synchronized (channels) {
303                    channels.remove(this);
304                    if (channels.isEmpty()) {
305                        unregisterAsGenerator();
306                    }
307                }
308            }
309        }
310
311        /**
312         * Return the event that caused this channel to be created.
313         *
314         * @return the start event
315         */
316        public StartProcess startEvent() {
317            return startEvent;
318        }
319
320        /**
321         * Gets the down pipeline.
322         *
323         * @return the downPipeline
324         */
325        public EventPipeline downPipeline() {
326            return downPipeline;
327        }
328    }
329}
